intro: Lasiostelma sandersonii, commonly known as the sanderson's star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique blooming period, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
